metadata.title: CVE-2023-32252 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's ksmbd, a high-performance in-kernelSMB server. The specific flaw exists within the handling of SMB2_LOGOFFcommands. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of a pointerprior to accessing it. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability tocreate a denial-of-service condition on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-32252` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-94-generic - 5.15.0-94.104
linux-image-5.15.0-94-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-94.104
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-94-generic - 5.15.0-94.104
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-94-generic-64k - 5.15.0-94.104
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-94.104').
linux-hwe-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.2, was needed').
linux-kvm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1050.55').
